Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

Username: Lloyd D Kashaya CAMSLloyd D Kashaya CAMS
Post Content:
Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

ğƒğ®ğ›ğšğ¢ ğˆğ¬ğ¬ğ®ğğ¬ ğğğ° ğ‘ğğ¬ğ¨ğ¥ğ®ğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§ ğ­ğ¨ ğ„ğšğ¬ğ ğ…ğ«ğğ ğ™ğ¨ğ§ğ ğğ®ğ¬ğ¢ğ§ğğ¬ğ¬ ğ„ğ±ğ©ğšğ§ğ¬ğ¢ğ¨ğ§Dubai has introduced a new resolution regulating free zone company operations, making it easier for businesses to expand within the emirate.Issued by Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Bin Rashid, Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of the Executive Council, the resolution allows free zone companies to operate in mainland Dubai, provided they obtain the necessary permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Post Content:
Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

ğƒğ®ğ›ğšğ¢ ğˆğ¬ğ¬ğ®ğğ¬ ğğğ° ğ‘ğğ¬ğ¨ğ¥ğ®ğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§ ğ­ğ¨ ğ„ğšğ¬ğ ğ…ğ«ğğ ğ™ğ¨ğ§ğ ğğ®ğ¬ğ¢ğ§ğğ¬ğ¬ ğ„ğ±ğ©ğšğ§ğ¬ğ¢ğ¨ğ§Dubai has introduced a new resolution regulating free zone company operations, making it easier for businesses to expand within the emirate.Issued by Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Bin Rashid, Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of the Executive Council, the resolution allows free zone companies to operate in mainland Dubai, provided they obtain the necessary permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Is Dubai Real Estate Market booming at a spectacular pace? ğŸ™ï¸ They say itâ€™s breaking record every month. With more investors looking to purchase the right property, how do you think one should choose?Here are few important tips that I usually share with my buyers while purchasing a residential property in Dubai:â–ªï¸ Investment Criteria:Firstly, make sure youâ€™re aware of what your requirements, expectations and priorities are.For an investor this can either be rental returns or capital appreciation.But an end user might be looking for a better neighbourhood, conveyance to their workplace, schools etc.â–ªï¸ Price:Draft an exact idea about the amount of money you want to invest in a property. One must have enough liquidity to cover all the payment plans.â–ªï¸ Location:Finding the best location simply becomes on of the most important factors of a purchase. Buyers must be aware of infrastructure developments going to happen in the location where they are looking to purchase. They should analyze the current supply and demand of properties as well as create an estimate of the future supply inflows in that particular locality. An investor should be aware of the price per sqft of the properties in the locality and should have a better understanding of the appreciation value in the future by analyzing the infrastructure developments and government initiatives to happen in the future.For an end user conveyance to meet daily needs such as the distance from the office, school for their children etc., along with a neighbourhood that provides you a space of comfort and peaceful living could be the primary preference.â–ªï¸ Payment Plan:While selecting an off-plan property, the buyer should be aware of the payment plans provided by the developer.These payment plans are scheduled over the construction period and it should be convenient in accordance with the liquidity of the buyer. Different developers offer different sort of payment plans according to the project and their demand.â–ªï¸ Developer:Last but not least, the Developerâ€™s profile is one of the most crucial aspects to consider while purchasing a property.The buyer should be aware of the track record of the developer such as the previous completed projects, construction timeline of the previous projects, quality of the buildings from previous projects, and whether they have an escrow account for the transfer of money.Given above are simply a few details one should consider before making an investment in real estate. There are definitely a lot other things to consider too, and this is where a property consultant comes into play.Share your thoughts!Looking to invest in this booming market? Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

Dubai recently implemented a new regulation allowing free zone-licensed companies to conduct business across the emirate after obtaining the necessary permit from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism. This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. This strategic step is poised to streamline business functions, fostering a conducive environment for operational efficiency and fostering growth prospects for enterprises in Dubai.For further details on compliance with this progressive regulation, feel free to reach out to us. hashtag#BusinessRegulation hashtag#DubaiEconomy hashtag#DualLicenses

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubaiâ€™s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubaiâ€™s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Recent post by Shri Suresh Narayanan CMD at Nestle was truly inspiring.   As the CMD, his concern about the potential impact these fraudulent ads could have on young aspirants is highly commendable.  His proactive approach in addressing this issue not only raises awareness but also reinforces our commitment to integrity and transparency.Many such fake job posts of leading corporate companies are being circulated in social media, which could potentially mislead job seekers.In Malabar Gold & Diamonds all job posts have our jobportal details and it is posted by management team members after approval by the relevant authorities. Is Dubai Real Estate Market booming at a spectacular pace? ğŸ™ï¸ They say itâ€™s breaking record every month. With more investors looking to purchase the right property, how do you think one should choose?Here are few important tips that I usually share with my buyers while purchasing a residential property in Dubai:â–ªï¸ Investment Criteria:Firstly, make sure youâ€™re aware of what your requirements, expectations and priorities are.For an investor this can either be rental returns or capital appreciation.But an end user might be looking for a better neighbourhood, conveyance to their workplace, schools etc.â–ªï¸ Price:Draft an exact idea about the amount of money you want to invest in a property. One must have enough liquidity to cover all the payment plans.â–ªï¸ Location:Finding the best location simply becomes on of the most important factors of a purchase. Buyers must be aware of infrastructure developments going to happen in the location where they are looking to purchase. They should analyze the current supply and demand of properties as well as create an estimate of the future supply inflows in that particular locality. An investor should be aware of the price per sqft of the properties in the locality and should have a better understanding of the appreciation value in the future by analyzing the infrastructure developments and government initiatives to happen in the future.For an end user conveyance to meet daily needs such as the distance from the office, school for their children etc., along with a neighbourhood that provides you a space of comfort and peaceful living could be the primary preference.â–ªï¸ Payment Plan:While selecting an off-plan property, the buyer should be aware of the payment plans provided by the developer.These payment plans are scheduled over the construction period and it should be convenient in accordance with the liquidity of the buyer. Different developers offer different sort of payment plans according to the project and their demand.â–ªï¸ Developer:Last but not least, the Developerâ€™s profile is one of the most crucial aspects to consider while purchasing a property.The buyer should be aware of the track record of the developer such as the previous completed projects, construction timeline of the previous projects, quality of the buildings from previous projects, and whether they have an escrow account for the transfer of money.Given above are simply a few details one should consider before making an investment in real estate. There are definitely a lot other things to consider too, and this is where a property consultant comes into play.Share your thoughts!Looking to invest in this booming market? Contact me for expert guidance!

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2)Â D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAEâ€™s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸â­•ï¸ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡ https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone.
